data.text:
A new trend in travel marketing we're noticing: DJs and musicians are shining a new light on bucket list destinations by live-streaming performances from spectacular natural attractions. These captivating videos, set against stunning backdrops of glaciers, waterfalls, and volcanic landscapes, merge music with natural beauty, inspiring viewers to visit these remote destinations. We wouldn't be surprised if destination marketers jump on this trend and we see much more of it. Watch more at: https://lnkd.in/d3nZEZXN #travelmarketing #travelinspo #marketingagency

Adobe's Chief Strategy Officer, Scott Belsky, recently stated that it will not train its AI models using artists' work without permission, underscoring its commitment to respecting intellectual property rights. This has implications across the branding and creative sectors, as it shows a company firmly taking a side in the rapidly evolving landscape of artificial intelligence. As the debate over AI and intellectual property intensifies, Adobe's stance could set a precedent. We'll be watching to see if other companies will follow suit, or embrace AI. #adobe #marketingnews

Nothing is more synonymous with luxury and travel than Louis Vuitton, and so it's no surprise that France's most heralded luxury brand is teaming up with the Paris Olympics to boost global visibility and connect with diverse audiences. From a brand point of view, these kinds of collaborations boost relevance and highlight shared values around major events. For Paris 2024, Louis Vuitton has crafted two Medal Trunks for the Olympic and Paralympic Games and two Torch Trunks for the official torches, celebrating French heritage in grand style. #parisolympics2024 #olympics2024 #louisvuitton

The Bear gives us an inside look at the chaos of kitchen life. It has become a favourite of entertainment and hospitality industry insiders alike for showing the raw passion (and high stress levels) that go into running a successful eatery. The much-anticipated third series of the show premieres in June, see a link to the trailer here: https://lnkd.in/dve_MAKR #thebearfx

Private members clubs have long been a staple in London but they've recently experienced a post-COVID resurgence in NYC. As highlighted in a recent GQ article, "it is not a new phenomenon in major urban areas around the world, but this is the crest of a whole new wave of options in a city that has not regarded club membership as a signifier for cool in quite some time." In today's world, where privacy is a luxury, these new clubs provide a sanctuary for authentic interactions. Who would have thought the aftermath of a pandemic would lead us back to these exclusive, photo-free havens? Take a read of this recent piece by Emily Sundberg in GQ for more: https://lnkd.in/eVCzNceG #marketing #creativeagency #newyorkupdates

Did you know using a consistent colour palette in all your brand’s collateral can improve brand recognition by up to 80%, according to market research? Though it's often overlooked, being intentional and consistent about colour usage in your branding is a subtle way to increase brand awareness and leave a lasting impression on your intended audience.
